section.title: Description
section.p: isascii is a macro which returns non-zero when c is an ASCII character, and 0 otherwise. It is defined for all integer values.
You can use a compiled subroutine instead of the macro definition by undefining the macro using `#undef isascii'.

section.title: Returns
section.p: isascii returns non-zero if the low order byte of c is in the range 0 to 127 (0x00--0x7F).
